intro: Reseda toletana, commonly known as Toletan ragwort, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as fields and roadsides. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Reseda toletana is primarily of interest in botanical studies due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
